description: After agonizing debate and warnings from Council superiors, Rada decides to comply. She edits Halden's journals to remove details on BCI fail-safes and dissent warnings, choosing to broadcast only heavily approved fragments to preserve calm.

State media airs Rada's carefully edited report, framing Halden's legacy as orderly and supportive of Council unity. The public receives reassurances, but rumors of deeper secrets circulate in private circles.
Council, emboldened by restored narrative control, authorizes Directorate loyalists to reactivate legacy compliance patrols and step up neighborhood surveillance, aiming to preempt possible unrest.

As compliance patrols reappear and subtle crackdowns begin, citizens and Innovator engineers organize quiet resistance, using tactics learned from the 'invisible.' Sabotage and message-sharing grows in affected districts.

Evidence of Directorate's forged data and backdoor manipulations is leaked and rapidly spreads. Public outrage erupts, delegitimizing the Directorate and igniting city-wide calls for direct democracy, ending the attempted authoritarian revival.
